com.defano.jmonet.transform.image

Interface Transformable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    StaticImageTransformable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TransformableImageSelection, TransformableSelection
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JMonetCanvas, LassoTool, MarqueeTool

    public interface Transformable
extends StaticImageTransformable
    An image-containing object whose image can be transformed by a StaticImageTransform. This is a facade interface providing convenience methods for common transforms.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void adjustBrightness(int delta)
      Adjusts the brightness of the image by the amount specified in delta while preserving the image's alpha transparency.
      default void adjustTransparency(int delta)
      Adjusts the alpha transparency of the image while maintain hue, saturation and brightness.
      default void convolve(Kernel kernel)
      Performs a convolution of the image using the given kernel (convolution matrix).
      default void fill(Paint fillPaint, FillFunction fillFunction)
      Fills all transparent pixels in the image with the given fill paint.
      default void invert()
      Inverts the color of the image while preserving the alpha transparency.
      default void operate(BufferedImageOp operation)
      Performs a BufferedImageOp on the image.
      default void reduceColor(int colorDepth, Ditherer ditherer)
      Converts the image to a reduced palette containing no more than the specified number of colors.
      default void reduceGreyscale(int grayDepth, Ditherer ditherer)
      Converts the image to gray-scale, containing no more than the specified number of gray shades.
      default void removeTranslucency(boolean makeTransparent)
      Makes translucent pixels in the active selection either fully transparent or fully opaque.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.defano.jmonet.transform.image.StaticImageTransformable

        transform, transform

    • Method Detail

      • convolve

        default void convolve(Kernel kernel)
        Performs a convolution of the image using the given kernel (convolution matrix).
        Parameters:
        kernel - The Kernel to apply

      • operate

        default void operate(BufferedImageOp operation)
        Performs a BufferedImageOp on the image.
        Parameters:
        operation - The BufferedImageOp to perform.

      • reduceColor

        default void reduceColor(int colorDepth,
                         Ditherer ditherer)
        Converts the image to a reduced palette containing no more than the specified number of colors.

        This method uses a naive color quantization algorithm that does not optimize the reduced color palette for the given image; it simply produces a new palette with colors evenly distributed in the color space and maps colors in the selection image to the nearest color in the reduced palette.

        The number of unique colors in the reduced-color selection will not, necessarily, equal the provided color depth.

        Note that this method merely adjusts the look of the selection and does not affect the canvas' image storage in any way (all images are always stored in 24-bit "true color" irrespective of whether they have been reduced via this method. Thus, reducing colors will not reduce memory usage or affect how the image is exported or saved.

        Parameters:
        colorDepth - The maximum number of unique colors that should appear in the resultant selection image; zero produces a black and white (monochrome) image. Note that color depth should be cubic; if the cubed root of colorDepth is not an integer, the cube of the floor of the cubed root will be assumed.
        ditherer - The dithering algorithm to use, for example, FloydSteinbergDitherer.

      • reduceGreyscale

        default void reduceGreyscale(int grayDepth,
                             Ditherer ditherer)
        Converts the image to gray-scale, containing no more than the specified number of gray shades. See reduceColor(int, Ditherer) for details about palette selection and dithering.
        Parameters:
        grayDepth - The maximum number of unique shades of gray in which to render the given image; zero produces a black and white (monochrome) image.
        ditherer - The dithering algorithm to use, for example FloydSteinbergDitherer.

      • adjustBrightness

        default void adjustBrightness(int delta)
        Adjusts the brightness of the image by the amount specified in delta while preserving the image's alpha transparency.
        Parameters:
        delta - An amount by which brightness should be adjusted, -256 to +256. Negative numbers darken an image, positive numbers brighten it.

      • adjustTransparency

        default void adjustTransparency(int delta)
        Adjusts the alpha transparency of the image while maintain hue, saturation and brightness.
        Parameters:
        delta - An amount by which transparency should be adjusted -256 to +256; Negative numbers make the image more transparent, positive numbers make the image more opaque.

      • invert

        default void invert()
        Inverts the color of the image while preserving the alpha transparency.

      • removeTranslucency

        default void removeTranslucency(boolean makeTransparent)
        Makes translucent pixels in the active selection either fully transparent or fully opaque. Has no effect on pixels that are either fully opaque or fully transparent.
        Parameters:
        makeTransparent - When true, translucent pixels will become transparent; when false, opaque.

      • fill

        default void fill(Paint fillPaint,
                  FillFunction fillFunction)
        Fills all transparent pixels in the image with the given fill paint.
        Parameters:
        fillPaint - The paint to fill with.
        fillFunction - A method to fill pixels in the selected image
